cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north, then accelerating north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward Florida’s Big Bend, forecast to cross the southeast U.S. (GA/SC) and move offshore near the Carolina coast before heading into the western Atlantic toward Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (between Cedar Key and Tallahassee, FL)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Englewood to Indian Pass, FL; Tropical-storm Watch: South of Englewood to Chokoloskee, FL and Lower Florida Keys west of Seven-Mile Bridge; Storm-surge Watch: Chokoloskee to Indian Pass, FL including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Pinar del Rio, Cuba; Tropical-storm Warning: Yucatan Peninsula (Tulum to Rio Lagartos), Cozumel, Isle of Youth, Dry Tortugas, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, Georgia and South Carolina Low-country, and the coast of North and South Carolina (including Cape Fear to Cape Hatteras)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible late Thursday as the center passes southeast of Wilmington; probability of sustained 34 kt winds is low (≤16%, peaks around 96–120 h).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible along the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches if the center tracks close to shore.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Wednesday night into Thursday with pockets of flash flooding in the Wilmington area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and localized beach erosion beginning mid-week.
